report_title: Motorcycle Dealership and Repair Industry Report
executive_summary: The Motorcycle Dealership and Repair industry has managed to stay the course in recent years, enjoying new demand while fighting off pandemic-related struggles. The COVID-19 outbreak caused widespread lockdowns and business closures, leading to struggles as economic conditions worsened. As disruptions faded, the industry saw renewed demand driven by expanding consumer confidence and disposable income. Sales rose but demand for repairs remained limited since motorcycles don't endure much wear and tear from leisure use.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Both industry establishments and enterprises have declined since 2007 due to the aging main demographics. The pandemic accelerated consolidation as non-employers struggled while enterprises expanded influence. Revenue is expected to grow at a 0.6% CAGR through 2024 despite 3.9% growth in 2024. Profit has shrunk to 1.9% of revenue in 2024 from 3.3% in 2019 largely due to COVID-19.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Sent Motorcycle Dealerships on a Detour
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Larger dealerships recovered from the pandemic while smaller ones struggle with shifting demographics, high interest rates and lower consumer confidence. Dealership closures led to revenue growth in 2020 from stimulus spending. Interest was constrained in 2021 by inflation. As conditions improved, feelings of adventure drew in consumers.

As the primary motorcycle demographic ages, dealerships scramble for new customers. Younger riders are discouraged by safety concerns. Growing climate consciousness pushes younger generations to more eco-friendly options like scooters. More women are riding motorcycles now than ever.

Motorcycles are primarily used for fun, making them discretionary purchases dependent on consumer confidence and access to credit. Since they are secondary transportation, they endure less wear so demand for repairs is low compared to new bike sales.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Dealerships Will Focus on Drawing In New Riders
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As existing enthusiasts age out, appealing to new customers will become more important. Demographics will shift toward younger customers preferring off-highway models. Persistent inflation threatens access to credit for purchases.

Key input material prices spiked after the pandemic but are expected to settle back to pre-pandemic levels as instability subsides. Lower input costs will reduce manufacturing costs, allowing dealers to improve profit.

Growing climate consciousness will result in more electric and efficient motorcycle models like scooters. Dealerships must be proactive in securing sustainable models from manufacturers ahead of the curve.

Consolidation trends are expected to continue as smaller dealerships struggle to keep pace with shifting demographics and discretionary purchases amid instability. Major dealers will acquire smaller ones and vertically integrate.

industry_definition: The Motorcycle Dealership and Repair industry sells or repairs motorcycles, all-terrain vehicles and personal watercrafts. Operators also provide repair services and retail replacement parts and accessories.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Households earning more than $100,000

key_trends: Motorcycles remain an expensive hobby. Healthy economic conditions and an increasing number of high earners are necessary to generate sufficient revenue.
Target demographics are shifting. Motorcycle enthusiasts are slowly aging out of the industry, pushing dealerships to focus on brining in younger customers.
Access to credit is necessary for dealerships to make a sufficient amount of sales. Most consumers can't afford to buy motorcycles outright.
Consumer confidence drives demand. It is hard to justify a large, discretionary purchase if you're not sure what your financial situation will be like in the near future.

New riders become the focus of dealerships. Motorcycle enthusiasts offer steady demand but will eventually age out of riding. Still, shifting demographics have provided opportunities for growth into new markets.
Wide product offerings help limit volatility. Dealerships seek to stay ahead of preference shifts by offering motorcycles and other motorized vehicles that cater to a variety of needs.

market_segmentation.segment: Motorcycle Enthusiasts Continue to Drive the Industry
market_segmentation.segment_description: Many baby boomers and members of generation X started riding motorcycles young, and have held onto their love of the open road ever since. They continue to be the primary customers of motorcycles in the United States.

Many restaurants rely on small, nimble and inexpensive off-highway motorcycles to make deliveries in dense cities, where parking is hard to come by. Farmers and ranchers use ATVs to get around their properties and tow equipment. These consumers must traverse vast properties with uneven terrain, for which ATVs are well suited.

Demand from different markets is growing as what has been a traditionally older and male-dominated hobby has expanded. Dealerships are strengthening their focus on these age groups to secure long-term revenue goals. Appealing to younger consumers includes adding lower power, off-highway motorcycles and focusing on more eco-friendly motorcycles. Younger consumers often have less disposable income, limiting their ability to access motorcycles.
The government purchases ATVs and other offroad vehicles for park services. These vehicles are suitable for navigating rough terrain and unpaved roads, making them ideal for park services.

tier_2_suppliers: Motorcycle, Bike & Parts Manufacturing in the US
Commercial Building Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: MOTORCYCLES CATER TO A VARIETY OF CUSTOMERS
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The appeal of the adrenaline rush and sense of adventure attached to riding motorcycles remains, driving steady demand for on-highway bikes. The high price point and discretionary nature of motorcycles mean that a growing economy is essential to industry success.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: OTHER MOTORIZED SPORTS VEHICLES OFFER THRILLS
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Watercraft, all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) and other recreational motorized vehicles command steady demand from vacationers and thrill seekers.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Repairs Account for a Steady but Small Portion of Revenue
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Since most riders use their bikes and other vehicles for leisure, they don't take on much wear and tear, limiting the need for repairs.

regulations_points.regulation_description: To function as a motorcycle dealership, many states require you to obtain a license.
The Consumer Product Safety Improvement Act of 2008 (CPSIA) banned the sale of motorcycles to people 12 years old and younger.

basis_points.basis_title: Securing young customers sets dealerships apart
basis_points.basis_description: The core demographic of motorcycle dealers is aging at a high rate.
Dealerships sell at a local level, so finding a location that caters to a large potential customer pool is key.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Motorcycle dealerships don't ship their products.
There are many successful nonemployers in the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Dealerships make their money off of reselling motorcycles they bought from manufacturers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: INCREASINGLY COMPLEX BIKES DRIVE UP WAGE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: New technology in motorcycles necessitates expert mechanics for service.
Profit fell as lockdowns dragged on.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital intensity is high for dealerships, as they must maintain inventory and facilities.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The drop in demand when restrictions were put into place hurt motorcycle dealerships.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Repairs account for a steady but small portion of revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since most riders use their bikes and other vehicles for leisure, they don't take on much wear and tear.

volatility_points.volatility_title: ACCESS TO CREDIT WILL CONTINUE TO CAUSE VOLATILITY
volatility_points.volatility_description: As inflation remains high, rising interest rates will disincentivize spending.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents.
Off-highway bikes have gained popularity as they are inexpensive and eco-friendly.

FAQs.question: What are some key points about sales and marketing for motorcycle dealerships?
FAQs.answer: Companies typically specialize in selling motorcycles and related parts.

FAQs.question: How do trade associations benefit the motorcycle industry?
FAQs.answer: The National Motorcycle Dealers Association provides educational and advocacy support.

FAQs.question: What are some key strategy and operations considerations for motorcycle dealerships?
FAQs.answer: Providing financing options can draw younger customers.

FAQs.question: How is technology utilized in the motorcycle dealership industry?
FAQs.answer: Point of sale systems are widely used to track inventory and manage sales.

FAQs.question: What are some key compliance considerations for motorcycle dealerships?
FAQs.answer: Dealerships must comply with state regulations and licensing requirements.

FAQs.question: How do finances and profitability look for motorcycle dealerships?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies earn higher profit margins due to brand awareness.

FAQs.question: What are the major bases of competition in the motorcycle dealership industry?
FAQs.answer: Key competitive factors include ability to offer a wide selection of popular models.

FAQs.question: How do economic factors like consumer confidence and disposable income impact the industry?
FAQs.answer: Higher consumer confidence and disposable income levels lead to more discretionary spending.
